title: Project-Based Instructional Design Training for Public Health Professionals in [K-12] Settings

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental public health theory and practical experience, along with basic digital literacy
context.additional_context: Education combining VR simulations with real public health scenario analysis in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners will appropriately select five types of instructional materials (online games, videos, handouts, PPT, infographics) when designing public health education programs.
Learners will develop education programs by applying design judgments (framing, core, tool, directional, and aesthetic judgments) in real public health scenarios.
Learners will iteratively improve instructional design prototypes based on peer feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
